title.narrative: Learning and Knowledge Management Facility UNIDO
Learning and Knowledge Management Facility UNIDO

description.narrative: Projektet syftar till att upprätta en facilitet, vilken skall inkludera samtliga sk PPPs som finansieras av Sida inom ramen för yrkesutbildning. Facilitet skall utgöra en plattform för ömsesidigt lärande, utbyte av kunskap samt för att kunna identifiera ny initiativ/överföra best practices. UNIDO är Sidas kontraktspart.

The project aims at establishing a facility integrating the various public private partnership (PPP) programmes funded by Sida for skills development and will serve as a platform for collaborative learning, knowledge sharing and indentification of/transfer of best practices. UNIDO is the Sida contracting partner.

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: Learning and Knowledge Development Facility (LKDF) is a Public Private Development Partnership (PPDP) program focusing on industrial skills development in developing countries. This program aims at: a) establishing, in partnership with global manufacturing companies (such as SCANIA, VOLVO, FESTO, Komatsu), training academies for the operation and maintenance of heavy equipment in the sectors of transport, material handling, agricultural equipment construction, and (ii) expanding access of youth to job-oriented and demand-driven skills in the sectors of logistics and industrial maintenance of machinery. These programmes are currently being implemented in Iraq, Ethiopia, Morocco, South Africa, Zambia and Liberia. Similar projects are being prepared for Morocco, Indonesia, Tunisia and Uzbekistan. The objective of LKDF is to provide support to PPDPs that focus on industrial skills development that aim at contributing to the establishment of efficient market oriented vocational training centers (VTCs), by facilitating learning and knowledge sharing. The main clusters of activities are a) result-based learning and knowledge development system, b) management training, and c) project development facility. In 2016 the LKDF facilitated knowledge exchange between the 6 ongoing PPDP projects currently under its umbrella (Ethiopia/Volvo, Kurdistan/Scania, Morocco/Volvo, South Africa/Finland SME, Liberia/Komatsu and Zambia/Volvo). Support has been provided according to project needs such as M&E and business planning. Special emphasis was put on promoting knowledge exchange between the project in Ethiopia and the more recent projects in Morocco and Zambia. Between 4 to 6 planned PPDP projects are in the pipeline (Indonesia/Volvo, Morocco/FESTO, Morocco/TBD, Tunisia/OMV, Uzbekistan/TBD). There is also close links to a ongoing UNIDO managed PPDP project in Bangladesh/Tetra Pack. In 2016 the LKDF Annual partners Learning Workshop was held. Examples of LKDF learning products published/produced: a) Over the years in total 5 "How-to Guides", b) Best practice documents, e.g., on gender, c) Three Toolkits, d) a number of Learning nuggets, e) Curricula developed with private sector partners, f) Animated films, g) Impact story interviews, and h) Newsletters. The Knowledge sharing and learning platform was created with around 1000 visitors per month. The LKDF website, Facebook and Twitter pages was updated. Over the years LKDF organised 5 PPDP training sessions.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
